com.b2international.snowowl.datastore.cdo

Class CDOUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.b2international.snowowl.datastore.cdo.CDOUtils

  • public abstract class CDOUtils
extends Object
    Utility class for CDO objects and for their underlying CDO views.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  CDOUtils.CDOObjectToCDOIDAdjuster
      CDO reference adjuster to replace an actual CDO object instance with its CDO ID.

      static boolean checkObjectRefernces(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.CDOObject object)
      This method checks whether the specified object can be referenced and all the references can be referenced as well.
      Returns with true only and if only the specified state of the object fulfill the following constraints: Specified object is *NOT* null. The CDO state of the object is *NOT* transient. The underlying CDO view is *NOT* null. The underlying CDO view is *NOT* closed. All the references of the specified object are *NOT* null. If any of the reference of the specified object is a CDO object, then the reference will be investigated according to the 1. - 4. items.
      static boolean checkView(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.view.CDOView view)
      Returns true only and if only the specified CDO view instance can be referenced (it is not null) and is NOT closed.

      • checkObject

        public static boolean checkObject(@Nullable
                                  org.eclipse.emf.cdo.CDOObject object)
        Returns true only and if only the specified object is not null. The object is not detached. (In other words its state is NOT transient.) And the underlying CDO view can be referenced.
        Parameters:
        object - the CDO object to check. Can be null.
        Returns:
        true if the object can be referenced, otherwise returns with false.
        See Also:
        checkView(CDOView)

        Parameters:
        view - the CDO view to check. Can be null.
        Returns:

      • check

        public static <T extends org.eclipse.emf.cdo.CDOObject> T check(T object)
        Ensures that an CDOObject reference passed as a parameter to the calling method fulfills the followings:
        • *NOT* null.
        • the associated CDO view is *NOT* null.
        • the associated CDO view is active.
        • the object is not transient.
Type Parameters:
T - type of the CDOObject
Parameters:
object - the CDOObject to check.
Returns:
the CDOObject that was validated against above described.

  • getObjectIfExists

    @Nullable
public static <T extends org.eclipse.emf.cdo.CDOObject> T getObjectIfExists(@Nonnull
                                                                                       org.eclipse.emf.cdo.view.CDOView view,
                                                                                       long cdoId)
    Returns with the CDO object looked up in the specified CDO view with a unique CDO ID.
    Parameters:
    view - the view where the lookup should be performed. Cannot be null. Cannot be closed.
    cdoId - the unique CDO ID of the object as long.
    Returns:
    the CDO object if found. May return with null if the object was not found with the specified CDO ID.

  • checkObjectRefernces

    public static boolean checkObjectRefernces(@Nullable
                                           org.eclipse.emf.cdo.CDOObject object)
    This method checks whether the specified object can be referenced and all the references can be referenced as well.
    Returns with true only and if only the specified state of the object fulfill the following constraints:
    1. Specified object is *NOT* null.
    2. The CDO state of the object is *NOT* transient.
    3. The underlying CDO view is *NOT* null.
    4. The underlying CDO view is *NOT* closed.
    5. All the references of the specified object are *NOT* null.
    6. If any of the reference of the specified object is a CDO object, then the reference will be investigated according to the 1. - 4. items.
    Parameters:
    object - the CDO object to check. Can be null.
    Returns:
    true if the object can be referenced. Otherwise returns false.

  • mergeTransaction

    public static void mergeTransaction(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.transaction.CDOTransaction oldTransaction,
                                    org.eclipse.emf.cdo.transaction.CDOTransaction newTransaction)
    Merges all the changes made on the old transaction to the other, clean transaction.
    Parameters:
    oldTransaction - the old transaction which changes should be merged onto the new one.
    newTransaction - the new transaction. Cannot be dirty.

  • resolveElementProxies

    public static void resolveElementProxies(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.CDOObject objectToResolve)
    Resolves all the element proxies on every persisted many valued feature for the given CDO revision argument.

  • applyChanges

    public static org.eclipse.emf.cdo.transaction.CDOTransaction applyChanges(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.transaction.CDOTransaction transaction,
                                                                          InputStream is)
                                                                   throws SnowowlServiceException
    Applies the changes to the given transaction..
    The object graph changes are given as a input stream.
    Although the transaction will return with a brand new transaction instance, clients should not take care of closing both specified and returning transactions. Closing one of them will close both transaction, and properly releases the resources.
    The specified stream will be closed, cannot be referenced after invoking this method.
    Parameters:
    transaction - the transaction to apply changes. Should be clean transaction.
    is - the object graph changes as a stream. Will be closed in anyway.
    Returns:
    the transaction containing the object graph changes read from the stream.
    Throws:
    SnowowlServiceException - if the stream cannot be referenced.

  • commitChanges

    public static org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.commit.CDOCommitInfo commitChanges(IBranchPath branchPath,
                                                                            String repositoryUuid,
                                                                            InputStream is,
                                                                            @Nullable
                                                                            String commitComment)
                                                                     throws SnowowlServiceException
    Applies and commits the changes to the HEAD of the branch given by its unique branch path.
    The object graph changes are given as a input stream. If the commit comment is given, then it will be set as the commit comment for the modification.
    This method attempts to merge conflicting changes if any, after the first failed commit attempt. The specified stream will be closed, cannot be referenced after invoking this method.
    Parameters:
    branchPath - the branch path where to apply the changes.
    repositoryUuid - the UUID of the repository.
    is - the object graph changes as a stream. Will be closed in anyway.
    commitComment - the commit comment. Optional, can be null.
    Returns:
    the commit comment returns as an outcome of the changes made in the repository.
    Throws:
    SnowowlServiceException - if either the stream cannot be referenced, or the commit failed due to CommitException.

  • adjustRevsions

    public static void adjustRevsions(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.transaction.CDOTransaction transaction,
                                  org.eclipse.emf.cdo.spi.common.revision.CDOReferenceAdjuster adjuster)
    Adjusts all revisions of the given transaction with the given adjuster. The following revisions will be adjusted:

    • All revision deltas of the last save point of the CDO transaction.
    • All new objects in the transaction.
    • All detached objects in the transaction.
    Parameters:
    transaction - the transaction where the revision adjustment has to be performed.
    adjuster - the reference adjuster.
    See Also:
    CDOTransaction.getLastSavepoint(), CDOReferenceAdjuster

  • copy

    public static <T extends org.eclipse.emf.cdo.CDOObject,E extends CDOEditingContext> T copy(T object,
                                                                                           E destinationContext,
                                                                                           boolean addToContainer,
                                                                                           boolean checkExistance)
                                                                                    throws SnowowlServiceException
    Copies the given object and all its related object graph to the destination editing context. Clients may decide whether the copied object has to be added to its original container/resource or not. Clients may also enable fail fast behavior when performing the copy.
    Parameters:
    object - the object to copy.
    destinationContext - the destination editing context,
    addToContainer - true if the replicated object has to be added to its container or not.
    checkExistance - flag to enable fail fast behavior. Client should consider performance drop when flag is true.
    Returns:
    the copied object.
    Throws:
    SnowowlServiceException - the copy operation failed.

  • toString

    public static StringBuilder toString(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.view.CDOView view)
    Creates and returns with a human readable representation of the given view as a StringBuilder instance.

  • bottomToTopIterator

    public static Iterator<org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.branch.CDOBranch> bottomToTopIterator(String repositoryUuid,
                                                                                        int branchId)
    Returns with an iterator for traversing the branch hierarchy from bottom to top. First element of the returning iterator will be the branch give with the ID argument. The following items are the ancestor ones if any. If the given branch ID argument is the MAIN branch ID, then this method returns with a single element iterator.
    Parameters:
    repositoryUuid - the unique ID of the repository.
    branchId - the unique CDOish ID of the branch.
    Returns:
    an iterator for traversing the branch hierarchy from bottom one to the top most MAIN branch.

  • bottomToTopIterator

    public static Iterator<org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.branch.CDOBranch> bottomToTopIterator(org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage ePackage,
                                                                                        int branchId)
    Same as bottomToTopIterator(EPackage, int). EPackage argument is resolved to the corresponding Application specific unique repository ID.

  • bottomToTopIterator

    public static Iterator<org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.branch.CDOBranch> bottomToTopIterator(org.eclipse.emf.cdo.common.branch.CDOBranch branch)
    Sugar for bottomToTopIterator(String, int).

    Creates and returns with a human readable representation of the given change set as a StringBuilder instance.
